Topic.Title: Land of the free

Message.Msg: Commentary from Paul R. Beane on KFYO radio on 1/24/2013: Good afternoon, I'm Paul R. Beane and I'm your right wing gun nut. You know, me and fellow gun owners are responsible for all the carnage in our streets and our schools. Never mind that Ted Kennedy's car has killed more people than my entire collection of firearms-- Most of which I have owned since childhood when I saved my pennies and nickels in order to purchase them and each and everyone is in perfect working order. It is the responsible gun owners of today that are being blamed for all the shootings. Obama calls us the right wing gun nuts, clinging to our guns and to our religion. But lets take a little closer look. The Fort Hood shooter, a Muslim, and a registered Democrat. The Virginia Tech shooter, he wrote hate mail to George Bush and his staff and was a registered Democrat. Aurora Colorado shooter, he was a staff worker on the Obama campaign and took part in Occupy Wall Street. He was a progressive liberal and guess what? A registered Democrat. The Newtown, Conn shooter hated Christians and was a registered Democrat. The Columbine high school shooters were too young to vote, but both of their families were progressive liberals and registered Democrats. And one more thing, not a single one of these killers were members of the National Rifle Association. So I have got it figured out how to make this country much safer; leave the guns alone and lock up all the Democrats. I'm Paul R. Beane and that's the way I see it

Topic.Title: US Is Secretly Collecting Records of Verizon Calls

Message.Msg: I had hoped that the Obama administration had put a stop to this sort of thing. Clearly we need to repeal or severely curtail the powers granted by the PATRIOT Act. Obama signed an extension to the PATRIOT Act two years ago when attempts to modify it in Congress failed. I'm more prone to trust Obama than I ever was to trust Bush/Cheney, but I think we can agree that granting this kind of power to any president is dangerous. It is a ridiculous breach of individual liberty and it always has been.

Topic.Title: Land of the free

Message.Msg: I think we need campaign finance reform so that money is less a part of politics in general, precluding the need for or benefit from Presidential fundraising at all. You're worried about trivialities--likely only because you can, at this moment, pin them to Obama. When Romney was campaigning in his taxpayer supported bus I didn't hear a peep from you. The fact is that every President, and his opponent in campaign years, need special security, including special transportation, which is paid for by taxpayers whenever they travel and for whatever reason. If you want to end all this fundraising you complain so loud about, then you need campaign finance reform. If you are not willing to support that then you have no credibility on this issue.

Topic.Title: Land of the free

Message.Msg: ...“…it is fair or (sic) any sitting President, from either Parry (sic)” “I don't think any political or lobbying group should be tax exempt ever. Any political 'information' group, fund raisers, special interest group sponsor should be tax exempt.” Well, golfboywinbag, I have absolutely no idea which of your beaucoup conspiracies you are addressing with the above rambling gibberish. First, if you really want to be taken seriously, learn how to construct a basic sentence and get a freakin’ dictionary. Please explain the difference between “any political or lobbying group” (who you don’t think should be tax exempt) and “any political information group, fund raisers, special interest group sponsor” (who you DO believe should be tax exempt?) They’re both political groups by your own definition, aren’t they? Do you have any idea what you’re really trying to say, or did your gerbil just run across your keyboard? And who in the hell do you think you are to be the arbiter of what delineates the travel duties of the President, from what you would like to call “political fund raising.” Are you referring to a specific event? Do you even know what you’re referring to? Do you even know where K Street is? Are you on drugs? It’s also very telling that you bring up the subject of campaign funding…but only as it relates to the President, for some strange reason. If this was anything other than just another of your smear attempts, wouldn’t you be complaining about all politicians, not just the President? Or, in your case, at least all the black politicians? What a joke…suggesting that you guys want to seriously do something about campaign finance reform?? Why don’t you start with overturning Citizens United? And, incidentally, I don’t think churches should be tax exempt, either…particularly the mega-churches who seem more interested in politics than salvation. OH, BLASPHEMY! And, Winnie, the repetitive use of “deflection” gives you away.

Topic.Title: Hey Rictardo

Message.Msg: It will? Wonderful! Any change in the health marketplace affects my business. The ACA is no different. But repeal of the ACA at this point would also increase business. Believe me, the hack selling "Obamacare Survival Guides" is making far more money off the law than I am. The biggest change for my business is that I will soon be able buy health insurance on the health exchange. I no longer have to rely on my wife's job. Which means she can quit and start her own business if she wants to. That's one of the many reasons I support Obamacare. But I could care less if you like Obamacare or not. Mainly I want you to have the information you need to make an honest assessment, and to allay any unfounded fears you may have about how the law will affect you. Most of the stories you hear are at best worst case scenarios that may affect a few people. Quite a few of them are outright lies.
